title: 107_hr2971
content: SECTION 1. GRANTING OF COPYRIGHT. Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. The owner of the copyright is entitled to all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. SEC. 2. WORK SUBJECT TO COPYRIGHT. Chaim Grade's works covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo," "Musarnikes," "Dojrois," "Oyf di Hurves," "Pleitim," "Farvoksene Vegn," "Der Mames Tzavoe," "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern," "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner," and "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah." Chaim Grade's works in section 1 include titles like "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern," "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner," "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah," "Hurbin," and "Vilna" with 5 major parts. Chaim Grade's works in section 2 include titles like "Di Shank" (The Tavern), "Der Ger-Tzadik" (The Convert), "Di Hiter fun der Shtot" (The Guardians of the City), "Unter di Gevelbte Toyern" (Beneath the Vaulted Gates), "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite" (Talmudic Scholars in Lithuania), "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir" (On My Way to You), and "Dos Alte Hoyz" (The Old House). In addition to Chaim Grade's works like "Di Shank" and "Der Ger-Tzadik," other titles include "Fun Unter der Erd" (From Beneath the Ground), "Yury Goresha," "Alte Boherim" (The Bachelors), and "In Gerangl mitn Malah" (Wrestling with the Angel). Titles mentioned in addition to Chaim Grade's works include "Yury Goresha," "Alte Boherim" (The Bachelors), "In Gerangl mitn Malah" (Wrestling with the Angel), "Chaim Nachman Bialik," "H. Leivik, The Poet of Suffering and Fate," "H. Leivik in my Life and my Works," and "Itzik Manger, the Poet of Beauty and Play." Titles mentioned in addition to Chaim Grade's works include "Yury Goresha," "Alte Boherim" (The Bachelors), "In Gerangl mitn Malah" (Wrestling with the Angel), "Chaim Nachman Bialik," "Three Yiddish Classics, Mendel, I.L. Peretz, Sholem-Alaychem," and "Anski, the Champion of Enlightenment, the Revolutionary and the Penitent." Titles mentioned in addition to Chaim Grade's works include "Yury Goresha," "Alte Boherim" (The Bachelors), "In Gerangl mitn Malah" (Wrestling with the Angel), "Chaim Nachman Bialik," "Three Yiddish Classics, Mendel, I.L. Peretz, Sholem-Alaychem," and "Anski, der Maskl, Revolutioner un Baal Tshuvah" (``Anski, the Champion of Enlightenment, the Revolutionary and the Penitent''). In addition to Chaim Grade's works, titles mentioned include "Yury Goresha," "Alte Boherim" (The Bachelors), "In Gerangl mitn Malah" (Wrestling with the Angel), "Chaim Nachman Bialik," and various essays on Yiddish literature and culture. In his works, Chaim Grade explores various themes such as Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, The Sabbath in Yiddish Literature, The Mussarists and Lithuanian Yeshivas, Sholem Aleichem, Jewish Life in Eastern Europe, Rabbi Israel Baal Shem Tov, and Rabbi Israel Salanter. In addition to exploring themes like Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, and The Sabbath in Yiddish Literature, Chaim Grade also delves into topics such as The Mussarists and Lithuanian Yeshivas, Sholem Aleichem, and Jewish Life in Eastern Europe with a focus on Rabbi Israel Baal Shem Tov and Rabbi Israel Salanter. The curr_chunk discusses various topics such as a memorial service for Count Potocki at the Grand Synagogue of Vilna, Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and struggle for Jewish life worldwide, and the question of whether Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia were Marranos. The curr_chunk includes lectures and essays on various topics such as Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, The Song of Songs, Saffed and Mount Miron, and people, stones, and plants in Eretz-Israel. The curr_chunk includes lectures and essays on topics like the uniqueness of Vilna, Histadruth, and Jewish life in Vilna before World War II. The curr_chunk contains lectures and essays on various topics such as the New Hebrew Literature in Israel, The Survivors of the German Concentration Camps, and Thirty Years Later. The curr_chunk includes lectures and essays on topics like New Hebrew Literature in Israel, The Survivors of the German Concentration Camps, and Thirty Years Later. It also covers The Soil and the Legend of the Land of Israel, The Last Controversies Among the Rabbis of Vilna, and American Yiddish Poets. The curr_chunk includes works by Chaim Grade, such as "The Last Controversies Among the Rabbis of Vilna" and "American Yiddish Poets."
